active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one partner explains service contract security requirements (e.g., WS-Security policies); the other teaches back using a hand-drawn diagram of service interactions.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario of inter-organizational SOA for healthcare data sharing (e.g., hospitals exchanging patient records), design an authentication/authorization flow mitigating trust issues, incorporating SAML/OAuth and policy enforcement points.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) Security (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Secure Design Principles > Security Architecture Principles > Distributed System Security > SOA Security). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to create high-quality, pedagogically optimized flashcards. **Content Sources:** Integrate the full topic summary: Core concepts (service, consumer/provider, registry/UDDI, contract, web services/SOAP/WSDL/XML). Security challenges: Increased attack surface, authentication/authorization trust issues, Confidentiality (interception), Integrity (tampering), Availability (DoS protection, throttling, redundancy), policy/governance. Mitigations: WS-Security (encryption/signing/tokens), SAML/OAuth, XML security, policy enforcement points/gateways. Voter consensus: Complete all sections, link prerequisites (networking/CIA/web services), connections (microservices/API security, ESB real-world). **Instructions:** 1. Generate exactly 50 flashcards covering all Bloom's levels and scaffolding layers proportionally. 2. 40% MCQs with distractors following the exact protocol (plausible misconceptions, similar terms, etc.). 3. Embed active learning hooks (e.g., questions prompting debate/analysis from discussion prompts). 4. Ensure scaffolding progression: 25% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 25% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4. 5. Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': #, 'distractors': ['opt1', 'opt2', 'opt3']}, 'metadata': {...}}, ...] Prioritize measurable outcomes, real-world examples (e.g., Target breach), and best practices for Anki/spaced repetition (concise fronts, detailed backs).
